instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4: What is PM_SLP_S4? This is a typo of PM_SLP_S4_L When you see PM_SLP_S4, assume they meant to type PM_SLP_S4_L.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.
definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Battery drain when in sleep
threads.message: Have this MacBook pro that runs without issues. But once you closed the lid (system goes to sleep, fan is off) and leave it closed overnight, by mid-day the next day, the battery is fully drained. Once, I check it when the lid was closed for a couple of hours and the boards was warm (fan wasn't running). No sure where to start from on this one as there are no corrosion on this board, board looks very clean. I'm about to order a usb-c to MagSafe 2 cable so that I connect it to my usb-c power meter monitor to see if the board is still pulling a lot current when it's off or when in sleep mode. But until i get that part, any suggestions on things to check?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Battery drain when in sleep
threads.message: Check if both <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>3_L</SIGNAL> disappear in sleep mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Battery drain when in sleep
threads.message:
Sorry for the late response

<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> - Remains at 3.3v after the system goes to sleep and the  fan shuts off
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> - Drops to 0 from 3.3v once the system goes to sleep and the fan shuts off

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Battery drain when in sleep
threads.message:
Looks good.
But machine must go to S5 state after some time, saving cache to SSD (maybe 30 min or so).
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> should drop to 0V then.
Check in System preferences if such option is available.
Or try another macOS installation.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Battery drain when in sleep
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> - Remains at 3.3v after the system goes to sleep and remains that way for close to an hour.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Battery drain when in sleep
threads.message:
Try another known good battery.
The board is still hot after 2 hours?
Check how much the battery is drained after 1 hour.
I'm talking about sleep mode, of course.
With a good multimeter, monitor the voltage across <RESISTOR>R7150</RESISTOR>, with only battery connected.
You can get the current dividing that voltage by resistor value.
Check if drops under 10mA in off state (battery alone).
Compare value with a good board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Battery drain when in sleep
threads.message:
One other thing, if there's still life in the battery, and i allow the computer to sleep for a few hours, when i wake it up, the board comes on with the fan spinning and it starts to ramp up until full spin, the display however never comes up.

Going to get you the above reading shortly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Battery drain when in sleep
threads.message:
Also, after about a 3 plus hours the battery only dropped about 2%. Plus this time around the board wasn't warm, but it did have the symptoms mentioned above with only the fan running, requiring me to reboot the system. 

Current across <RESISTOR>R7150</RESISTOR> is 49mA. This after the system has been in sleep for about an hour.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Battery drain when in sleep
threads.message:
There could be a problem caused by FDMF6808 chips.
Some scripts available on Internet, to disable CPU sleep states.
Try that to discard this problem.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Battery drain when in sleep
threads.message: Ok. Will replace that. Also, this morning i checked on it and the cpu is now warm with current across <RESISTOR>R7150</RESISTOR> now at 1.534A and the battery now at 27%. I'll let you know how it goes after FDMF6808 replacement.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Battery drain when in sleep
threads.message: So online it says to replace the FDMF6808 with FDMF6708, unfortunately i can't find any locally, will just replacing Phase 1 with a new FDMF6808 suffice for now. Also should i replace all 3 phases

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Battery drain when in sleep
threads.message: There are no new FDMF6808N, and taking them from donor boards isn't a good idea since they can develop the same problem. You can backorder FDMF6708N from Mouser. They're EOL though, not sure what will happen after the next shipment. FDMF3030 could be a suitable replacement but I don't think anyone tried it yet.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Battery drain when in sleep
threads.message: I actually have 3 F6808N from a couple years back when I ordered a bunch of them.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Battery drain when in sleep
threads.message:
FDMF6808N was never sold to anybody else than Apple.
All "new" chips on the market are fake, removed from boards.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Battery drain when in sleep
threads.message: crap. ok, guess i'll be waiting on the FDMF6708 then. thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Battery drain when in sleep
threads.message: Replaced all F6808 with F6708, still having the same issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Battery drain when in sleep
threads.message: Yeah, but you still have the problems mentioned before when machine comes back from sleep?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Battery drain when in sleep
threads.message: yep. by morning the battery is fully drained from 50% charge as well.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Battery drain when in sleep
threads.message:
"when i wake it up, the board comes on with the fan spinning and it starts to ramp up until full spin, the display however never comes up."
Same thing happens???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Battery drain when in sleep
threads.message: yep. Display doesn't come on but the fan turns on. It kinda looks like the fails we see with the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> boards that have the separate GPU where the GPUvcore chip <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> goes bad, except this model doesn't have this or does it something similar to it?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Battery drain when in sleep
threads.message: Try mentioned script about disanling CPU sleep states then.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Battery drain when in sleep
threads.message: This is now fixed. I decided to reinstall OS and it fixed it.
